intro: Trachytella aspera, commonly known as the rough trachyte, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming umbels that bloom in the summer. Trachytella aspera is primarily found in Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates.
